items.title: The Big Business of Bad Prison Food
items.description: A market analysis said the food service industry in U.S. prisons and jails is worth billions — and is forecasted to grow.

items.title: She’s Waited Decades for David Wood’s Execution. Now, Evidence Casts Doubt on His Guilt.
items.description: The case of a victim’s mother and one of the longest-serving death row prisoners shows how capital appeals can seem both endless and rushed.

items.title: How to Investigate Prison Staffing Trends in Your State
items.description: Our toolkit helps you report on how the widespread, long-term trend of declining prison staff affects both safety behind bars and state budgets.

items.title: Sheriff: Bodycam Footage From Cuyahoga County Deputies Will Now Come Out Within 7 Days
items.description: Policy shift follows a Marshall Project - Cleveland and News 5 Cleveland investigation into the October shooting of a teen by a deputy.

items.title: Law And Disorder: Police Oversight and Training Confront A Changing landscape
items.description: The future of police accountability remains uncertain as misconduct persists and focus shifts from reforms.
